DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study compare CO2 absorption gynecologic laparoscopy use AirSeal® valveless trocar system versus standard insufflation trocars intra-abdominal pressure 10 15 mmHg . The investigator hypothesize AirSeal® valveless trocar system , gynecologic laparoscopy perform low intra-abdominal pressure possible resultant decrease CO2 absorption , maintain adequate visualization operative field safe completion surgery .
DOC.detailed_description: Three main factor affect patient ' cardiopulmonary status gynecologic laparoscopy : 1 ) degree Trendelenburg tilt ( 25 - 30° ) , 2 ) carbon dioxide ( CO2 ) absorption 3 ) increase intra-abdominal pressure ( 10 -20 mmHg ) . Slight modification three factor lead significant decrease morbidity . The AirSeal® valveless trocar system reduce CO2 absorption compare standard trocars renal laparoscopy . Also , use trocar system provide stable intra-abdominal pressure compare standard trocars , feature could possibly allow laparoscopic surgery perform low intra-abdominal pressure .
DOC.criteria: Any woman ≥ 18 year age undergoing gynecologic laparoscopic procedure Able understand consent process willing participate study Patient unable undergo laparoscopic procedure due size pathology medical comorbidities Emergent surgery
